Sentencas: In direct carbon fuel cells (DCFCs), elemental carbon is electrochemically oxidised to generate electrical power.
Titulo: Solid state electrochemistry of direct carbon/air fuel cells

Sentencas: Carbon is readily available, easily transported and stored and, therefore, affordable to the global energy economy.
Titulo: Solid state electrochemistry of direct carbon/air fuel cells

Sentencas: Further operational advantages include the use of fully renewable solid bio-carbon fuel sources and the opportunity for scale-up.
Titulo: Solid state electrochemistry of direct carbon/air fuel cells

Sentencas: Herein we discuss a DCFC which utilises a molten mixed alkali metal carbonate eutectic as a secondary electrolyte, contained within a solid oxide fuel cell.
Titulo: Solid state electrochemistry of direct carbon/air fuel cells

Sentencas: The operation of small cells working as semi-fuel cells has been successfully demonstrated over an extended temperature range (525-900 degrees C) using a range of carbons derived from fossil, renewable and waste sources.
Titulo: Solid state electrochemistry of direct carbon/air fuel cells

Sentencas: Preliminary mechanistic studies demonstrate open circuit voltages (OCVs) well in excess of I V and indicate that direct oxidation and Boudouard conversion both contribute to the conversion process, with the dominant process changing with both temperature and extent of molten electrode/electrolyte component.
Titulo: Solid state electrochemistry of direct carbon/air fuel cells
